channel.title: Protected mp3s
channel.description:
Hey I've just got a quick question. I'm using Ruckus, a music program similart to Napster.
Whenever I download a music file from them, it's downloaded as a protected mp3 and stored on my computer. I was wondering if anybody knew how to convert this file to a regular mp3 file, so I can put the music on my iPod or something.
I've been looking all over the internet and have been unsuccessful in finding a solution. Any help would be greatly appreciated.
Thanks.

item.title: Protected mp3s
item.dc:creator: @oddinn686 oddinn686
item.description:
@oddinn686 wrote:

PaulT:

[quote]I know that there’s a way to get rid of the protection on mp3s, I just can’t figure it out.

Napster is no longer (and hasn’t been for a very long time) a way to steal music from the internet. When you say it’s “Like Napster” what you’re saying is “I pay for music on the internet” which is like saying “I’m a hooker who pays people to have sex with me”. So do you pay for these protected mp3 files or do you get them free?

Either way, you’re going about things the wrong way.

Just steal normal mp3 files. Limewire or bittorent should work fine.

The effort involved in breaking whatever encryption is on the mp3s is going to be greater than just downloading a (good) filesharing app and stealing the music the old fashioned way.

http://www.pistolwimp.com/media/48029/[/quote]

Ruckus is paid for by my college and my college doesn’t allow p2p programs.

I’d really hate to get thrown out just because I wanted to listen to a few songs.

Normally, I would have no problem with stealing them from Limewire, but you get in some serious trouble if you’re caught doing that here. I know what I’m doing is stealing, but I’m trying to do it in such a way that these IT guys over here can’t see.

Read full topic

item.title: Protected mp3s
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

I know that there's a way to get rid of the protection on mp3s, I just can't figure it out.

Napster is no longer (and hasn’t been for a very long time) a way to steal music from the internet. When you say it’s “Like Napster” what you’re saying is “I pay for music on the internet” which is like saying “I’m a hooker who pays people to have sex with me”. So do you pay for these protected mp3 files or do you get them free?

Either way, you’re going about things the wrong way.

Just steal normal mp3 files. Limewire or bittorent should work fine.

The effort involved in breaking whatever encryption is on the mp3s is going to be greater than just downloading a (good) filesharing app and stealing the music the old fashioned way.

http://www.pistolwimp.com/media/48029/

Read full topic

Stop being a dumbass and just steal music like everyone else.[/quote]

That’s exactly what I’m doing.

I know that there’s a way to get rid of the protection on mp3s, I just can’t figure it out.
